title: AMP Capital's CommIF gets out of bed for Macarthur
text:
When it comes to wind farms, they don't make 'em like they used to.

When it comes to wind farms, they don't make 'em like they used to.

The old "Hallett structure" set up by AGL Energy saw the utilities giant sell off its wind farm but retain all the wind, price, operations and maintenance risk under long-term contracts with the new owner.

For the new owner, it's about as risk free an investment as you can find. Revenue is locked in, there is no operating role and the only risk comes with refinancing the substantial debt packages, which happens every five to seven years.

Macarthur Wind Farm is the biggest operational wind farm in the southern hemisphere. Damian White

There's only a couple of "Hallet structure" wind farms in the country; Hallett, which is owned by Palisade Investment Partners, and Macarthur Wind Farm. Both were designed to last 25-years and are effectively underwritten by AGL.

So when Malaysia's Malakoff Corporation put its 50 per cent stake in the Macarthur joint venture up for grabs, it was always going to be a shootout between infrastructure investors with the lowest cost of capital.
description: When it comes to wind farms, they don't make 'em like they used to.
